youtube.com

üá∫üá∏ Rejected from US, Haitian migrants form community in Mexico l Al Jazeera English

item.author: Sanctuary4All Colorado

item.title: This a message to the public on the topic of immigration. Many...
item.content:encoded:
Sanctuary4All Colorado

This a message to the public on the topic of immigration. Many believe that as Biden entered office things would change but much seems to contain the same inhumanity as these pictures can demonstrate. These actions are inhumane that no one should ever go through. People coming from places where poverty is such an immense problem that it obligates them to migrate risking so much on the way here in search of a solution and they come to find this type of abuse. A lot within and ...outside this country on the topic of immigration has not changed. We keep fighting for a legalization for the more than 11 million immigrants placing hope that this legalization will be included in the reconciliation budget but we see that they keep placing obstacles with their political games. It is time that the community stands up now that during the pandemic immigrants were and are essential workers who were on the front lines exposing our health and lives so this country can stay on its feet. It is just that they give citizenship to all now that for decades nothing has been done. Now that there is a possibility, Congress continues to play. Come join us this Saturday at 11am on 29th and Federal in order to get demand that we receive citizenship for all. Join us and back our immigrant community. It does not matter who may be leading this or what organization are involved this is about searching for justice for our 11 million. Hope to see you there!

item.title: Sanctuary4All ColoradoSanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.On Monday Lupe received a cancer diagnosis. She‚Äôs been suffering from...
item.content:encoded:
Sanctuary4All ColoradoSanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

On Monday Lupe received a cancer diagnosis. She‚Äôs been suffering from a hernia for the last year, which has gone untreated because the hospital wouldn‚Äôt operate... on someone without health insurance. While monitoring the hernia, they discovered that she also has renal cancer. The full story and a link to her gofundme can be found at https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-lupe-pay-for-cancer-hernia-‚Ä¶. Please share, support, and pray for her full recovery. ‚ù§Ô∏è

item.content:encoded:
Sanctuary4All ColoradoSanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

On Monday Lupe received a cancer diagnosis. She‚Äôs been suffering from a hernia for the last year, which has gone untreated because the hospital wouldn‚Äôt operate... on someone without health insurance. While monitoring the hernia, they discovered that she also has renal cancer. The full story and a link to her gofundme can be found at https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-lupe-pay-for-cancer-hernia-‚Ä¶. Please share, support, and pray for her full recovery. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Gaby has been an incredible advocate not only for herself but other families in sanctuary for all, she has helped other families cook their solidarity meals and... flyer the neighborhood about our events! We are so grateful to everything she brings to sanctuary for all, support her fight and help keep her here by ordering solidarity meals this Saturday! https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.

Happy Hispanic and Latinx Heritage Month! üéâ

In celebration, we've curated five amazing TED.com and TEDxMileHigh recommendations!

1. America Ferrera: https://bit....ly/my-identity-is-a-superpower
2. Jeanette Vizguerra: https://bit.ly/no-son-v√≠ctimas
3. Gabby Rivera: https://bit.ly/marvel-queer-latina-superhero
4. Alejandro Jimenez: https://bit.ly/machismo-hurts-men-too
5. Lolita: https://bit.ly/toda-mi-gente

Watch them all and come back to tell us which speech or performance was your favorite ‚ù§Ô∏è

Psst - there's many more amazing Latinx speakers and performers on our website, this barely scratches the surface. Visit tedxmilehigh.com for more!

Gaby has been an incredible advocate not only for herself but other families in sanctuary for all, she has helped other families cook their solidarity meals and... flyer the neighborhood about our events! We are so grateful to everything she brings to sanctuary for all, support her fight and help keep her here by ordering solidarity meals this Saturday! https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.

item.title: Please suport and share!!
item.content:encoded:
Sanctuary4All Colorado

Please suport and share!!

Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

On Monday Lupe received a cancer diagnosis. She‚Äôs been suffering from a hernia for the last year, which has gone untreated because the hospital wouldn‚Äôt operate... on someone without health insurance. While monitoring the hernia, they discovered that she also has renal cancer. The full story and a link to her gofundme can be found at https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-lupe-pay-for-cancer-hernia-‚Ä¶. Please share, support, and pray for her full recovery. ‚ù§Ô∏è

item.title: Con demasiada frecuencia, los medios estadounidenses presentan a...
item.content:encoded:
Sanctuary4All Colorado

Con demasiada frecuencia, los medios estadounidenses presentan a los inmigrantes indocumentados como v√≠ctimas indefensas, pero eso no es la verdad. En esta fascinante presentaci√≥n, Jeanette Vizguerra cuenta su historia de cruzar la frontera, encontrar trabajo en los Estados Unidos y luchar por sus derechos. Es una historia de lucha, de dificultades, de coraje, de determinaci√≥n y, sobre todo, de resistencia. Jeanette Vizguerra es una orgullosa mujer mexicana, madre y abuela co...n 23 a√±os en los Estados Unidos como inmigrante. Se mud√≥ a los Estados Unidos para ser conserje, trabaj√≥ como organizadora sindical y construy√≥ su propia empresa. Too often the US media portrays undocumented immigrants as helpless victims, but that is not the truth. In this fascinating presentation, Jeanette Vizguerra tells her story of crossing the border, finding work in the United States, and fighting for her rights. After eight years of fighting deportation, she went public with her story and sought refuge with the First Unitarian Society of Denver. She founded Metro Denver Sanctuary Coalition, Sanctuary4All, and Abolish ICE Denver. She was named one of Time Magazine's 100 Most Influential People in 2017, but she remains a simple and humble being full of dreams and ideas.

In this fascinating presentation, Jeanette Vizguerra tells her story of crossing the border, finding work in the United States, and fighting for her rights. It's a story of struggle, of struggles, of courage, determination and above all of resilience. Jeanette Vizguerra is a proud Mexican woman, mother and grandmother aged 23 in the United States as an immigrant. She moved to the United States to be a janitor, worked as a union organizer and built her own company. After eight years of fighting deportation, he made public his story and sought refuge at First Unitarian Society of Denver. Founded Metro Denver Sanctuary Coalition, Sanctuary4All and Abolish ICE Denver.
